replies.body:
Local reporters get robbed inside Olympic Village (media)
Swimmers need to only ingest 3 teaspoons of water to be sure of catching a virus
Rio Officials lose keys to Olympic Stadium, have to break in with bolt cutters
Olympic Villages are not completed
New Zealand athlete captured by police and forced to withdraw from ATMs
Chinese athlete robbed of luggage, vomited on upon Rio arrival
Olympic Committee officially prohibits gifs, webms, vines, of Rio Olympics
Athletes told to keep 'quiet' about contamination in water, or else
Great Britian athletes robbed of swimming kits; some do not have any
Committee to give medals to athletes in Olympics who make it out alive
NBC to delay broadcast by an hour to make content curated, better looking
12 of 31 olympic villages pass inspection
Chinese basketball team shot at in midst of shooting
1.3 million tickets left unsold, Rio Officials
New Zealand athlete flees Rio after numerous police run-ins
Olympic Village hotel flooded after huge water leak
Athelete Vilage pictures are illegal to release due to negative publicity

The best: Non-sponsors banned from tweeting anything about the olympics

replies.body:
I already had the pleasure of meeting all of the USA Taekwondo Olympic athletes, and several from other countries, such as Moldova, Korea, Iraq, Great Britain, Spain, and Mexico.
I think Jackie Galloway has an okay shot at winning a medal, as does Stephen Lambdin, but I know that Steven Lopez will lose to Moldovan athlete Aaron Cook, and I've already bet a substantial amount of money on Cook getting the gold, as he's already ranked #1 in the world for his division.
Paige McPherson has to get a medal, she's one of the best in her division.
Despite losing in the London Olympics, I think that Lee Dae-hoon of Korea will go on to win the gold medal this time around, considering his overwhelmingly good performance in the 2015 World Championship.

Paige McPherson has to get a medal, she's one of the best in her division.
Despite losing in the London Olympics, I think that Lee Dae-hoon of Korea will go on to win the gold medal this time around, considering his overwhelmingly good performance in the 2015 World Championship.
